results.title: Salima in transition
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Max Reid and Frances Reid
results.brief_description: A documentary of an African culture in transition. Focuses on a secondary school in the town of Salima in Malawi, a former British colony in central Africa. Shows a group of English speaking students in the process of making the transition from their rural background into the educated class of an emerging nation. Pictures life in Salima, and a visit to a village.

results.title: Sale Reveur = Dirty Dreamer
results.creator_credit: Daniele Delorme, Yves Robert and Jean-Marie Perier
results.brief_description:
Jerome, is a stuntcar racer still living out teenage fantasies of being Paul Newman. Although surrounded by an urban jungle of parking lots and high rise towers, he likes to think of himself as ‘Hud’ and his long suffering girlfriend does nothing to play down the fantasy.

Credits: Producers, Yves Robert, Daniele Delorme ; director, Jean-Marie Perier ; writers, Jean-Marie Perier, Pascal Jardin, Lucien Elia ; photography, Yves Lafaye ; music, Sydney Bechet, Jacques Dutronc ; decors, Theo Meurisse.
Cast: Jacques dutronc, Lea Massari, Jean Bouise, Maurice Benichou, Nathalie Perier, Greg Germain, Anemone.

results.title: Sale by sample
results.brief_description: This film shows the wool-store operations associated with sale by sample. All operations are clearly shown from receival, the sampling line, and cataloguing to the auction sale. The “close-ups” of the sampling line and the mechanical handling in a single-level wool-store are extremely informative. The commentary is very clear and adequately describes the salient points. The film is recommended for wool-classing at an advanced level. No credits available.

results.title: Salam Cafe. Episode 13 (Season  2)
results.creator_credit: Ahmed Hassan, Jehed Dabab and C31 Melbourne
results.brief_description: ‘Salam Café has no group or organisational affiliation - we’re just a group of mates who thought it might be good to give Melbourne a window on everyday Muslims, and have fun at the same time!’ In this episode Salam Cafe 2 Go visit the MCG on the Grand Final day. The panel interview Qamar Atosh, the National Winner of the YAMY award. Along with our previous guest Monique to discuss the YAMY night. In the absense of Susan, her husband Waleed reveals the winner of the photo comp. We hear about the recent Declaration of Faith Based Schools drafted by representatives of Christian, Jewish and Islamic Colleges.

results.title: Salaam Bombay!
results.creator_credit: Mirabai Films, Cadrage (Paris), Channel 4 and Mira Nair
results.brief_description: Abandoned by the travelling fair for which he works, 11 year old Krishna takes a train to the nearest city - Bombay. He is initiated into the ways of the city by various members of a children’s street gang and, determined to save up enough money to get home, begins work at the bottom of the street hierarchy as a “Chaipau” or tea-boy. Through his eyes we glimpse a Bombay never seen in traditional Indian studio-based films, a city of madness and cacophony, where flesh and drugs are traded and everywhere there are children like Krishna, surviving and succumbing to the appetite of the raging metropolis. Movingly acted by real street kids this film is an eloquent addition to the cinema’s portraits of troubled childhood.

results.title: Saint-Urbain in Troyes
results.creator_credit: Francois Seguillon, ONF | NFB and Yves Leduc
results.brief_description: A study of one of the oldest Gothic cathedrals of France, built in 1262 during what was known as the century of cathedrals. This film shows the details of exteriors and interiors - the lofty spire, the lacework of stone, and the luminous flood of light through stained glass windows. Comparisons are made between St. Urbain and other ancient French churches. The city of Troyes is seen as it is today and as it was in medieval times.

results.title: Sails of exploration
results.brief_description: Shows the historical development of water transportation by sail power, describing the role of such ships in discovering new lands, mapping the globe, and linking together the people of the world. Discusses the importance of the clipper ship in the early economic life of the United States. Includes re-enactments, drawings and archival film.

results.title: Sailors in the making
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Australia. Royal Australian Navy. Public Relations
results.brief_description: The training of recruits at the Flinders Naval Depot. Basic training given to all recruits in seamanship, fire-fighting and damage control. The training ships and the facilities of the Depot for self-improvement - library, common room, theatre, chapels, sport. Some of the thirteen special schools - naval gunnery, electrical, engineering and advanced seamanship.
